field.label: Name
field.helptext: Choose a unique name for your component pack.

field.label: Active
field.helptext: When active, component packs are available for use within the App Composer. When toggled inactive, components can still appear for end users at runtime, but new instances cannot be added to pages within the App Composer.

field.label: Display Order
field.helptext: Set the order in which your custom component packs will display under the Skuid default component packs in the Elements Pane.

field.label: First component label
field.helptext: Choose a friendly label for your first component.

field.label: Used to determine if components in component pack should show
Name
field.helptext: Choose a unique name for your component pack.

field.label: Display Order
field.helptext: Set the order in which your custom component packs will display under the Skuid default component packs in the Elements Pane.

field.label: First component label
field.helptext: Choose a friendly label for your first component.

field.label: Name
field.helptext: Choose a unique name for your component pack.

skuid__text.contents: Deleting this component pack will affect all pages that include these components.
Are you sure you want to permanently delete this component pack? You can't undo this.
You haven't created any component packs.

A component pack is a collection of components that can be used on Skuid pages. If you are designing custom components, you’ll need to create a component pack to distribute the components to users within Skuid.

actionsequence.label: Add pack
actionsequence.description: Create or import a new pack

skuid__text.contents: Would you like to create a new component pack or import an existing one?
We'll generate some boilerplate code to build your own component pack.
Upload an existing component pack to use in your Skuid pages.

Skuid pages can be built with one of two page APIs. This choice determines how the components must be coded.

V2 component packs can only be used in v2 pages and v1 packs can only be used in v1 pages.
v2 components can be built using the virtual DOM or direct DOM manipulation
v1 components are built using direct DOM manipulation
We've generated some boilerplate component code to get you started. Refer to our docs for more information on how to build your components.
If you want to edit this with local tools, download the ZIP file
Your component pack has been successfully imported. You can now use its components within the App Composer.

actionsequence.label: Handle error
actionsequence.description: Runs when there's an error finding component names

action.message: Error finding components for this pack
